EmailTemplate.name: Post-Class Follow-up Marketing
EmailTemplate.subject: Follow-up to Effective Marketing Management with Salesforce.com
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for attending Effective Marketing Management with Salesforce.com. The purpose of this email is to provide you with the documents reviewed during training, instructions on how to complete your Application Assessment (Test) and guidance on the next steps in your training roadmap.
Several links are provided below. In order to download the appropriate document, or complete the appropriate evaluation, please click on the link or copy/paste it into your browser.
The presentation reviewed during your classroom training session included overviews on the use of many Salesforce.com features as well as step-action instructions to help you being using these features. You may download the training presentation here:
https://na1.salesforce.com/sfc/p/30000000lp1baVX0eKD85vRbMPwjujqRuwTVmWA=
We have also created shortened “cheat-sheet” for all Salesforce.com users, which you may access here:
https://na1.salesforce.com/sfc/p/30000000lp1bb47Hvo6UjffIA0ErUUwMauIfd10=
As we continue to learn together, it is important that we assess the skills which each trainee has developed. Please take 15-30 minutes to complete this Application Assessment regarding the materials covered in your Training Roadmap up to, and including your classroom training session:
http://hslearning.intra.sears.com/HSL/Training/Salesforce-Training.aspx (select course 3073)
Looking ahead, please be aware of and ready for the following items on the Marketing and Product Manager Training Roadmap:
□ Complete your Case training classroom sessions (Product Managers only)
□ Complete your e-Learning as outlined in your Training Roadmap
□ Attend your classroom training debrief which will be scheduled shortly
Thank you for having the courage to change your habits and your ongoing efforts to implement this powerful tool. The impact we are making to Sears Commercial will be profound.
Best,
{!User.FirstName}
